blog.name: she-wolf-of-highgarden
blog.title: They Danced Through The Day And Into The Night
blog.description: 23/grad student/book nerd/ lover of arya stark/ Meera Reed defender/ searching for Edric Dayne/ mainly Jonrya and Gendrya

tags: A Song of Ice and Fire
summary: Something i see again and again in the ASoIaF fandom is that people who love Arya do so because she rejects femininity. As...
body:
Something i see again and again in the ASoIaF fandom is that people who love Arya do so because she rejects femininity. As someone who is feminine, i find this kind of annoying because honestly femininity has nothing to do with how i feel about her. So here are my top five reasons for loving Arya Stark:

1. Her empathy 

“The bars were too narrow to pass a cup through, but Harwin and Gendry offered her a leg up. She planted a foot in Harwin’s cupped hands, vaulted onto Gendry’s shoulders, and grabbed the bars on top of the cage. The fat man turned his face up and pressed his cheek to the iron, and Arya poured the waterover him. He sucked at it eagerly and let it run down over his head and cheeks and hands, and then he licked the dampness off the bars. He would have licked Arya’s fingers if she hadn’t snatched them back. By the time she served the other two the same, a crowd had gathered to watch her. “The Mad Huntsman will hear of this,” a man threatened. “He won’t like it. No, he won’t.” - Arya V, ASoS

“ It was even worse than before; Lady Smallwood insisted that Arya take another bath, and cut and comb her hair besides; the dress she put her in this time was sort of lilac-colored, and decorated with little baby pearls. The only good thing about it was that it was so delicate that no one could expect her to ride in it. So the next morning as they broke their fast, Lady Smallwood gave her breeches, belt, and tunic to wear, and a brown doeskin jerkin dotted with iron studs. “They were my son’s things,” she said. “He died when he was seven.”“I’m sorry, my lady.” Arya suddenly felt bad for her, and ashamed. “I’m sorry I tore the acorn dress too. It was pretty.” - Arya IV, ASoS

2. Her friendliness 

“ Sansa knew all about the sorts of people Arya liked to talk to: squires and grooms and serving girls, old men and naked children, rough-spoken freeriders of uncertain birth. Arya would make friends with anybody. This Mycah was the worst; a butcher’s boy, thirteen and wild, he slept in the meat wagon and smelled of the slaughtering block.” - Sansa I, AGoT

“ Cat had made friends along the wharves; porters and mummers, ropemakers and sailmenders, taverners, brewers and bakers and beggars and whores. They bought clams and cockles from her, told her true tales of Braavos and lies about their lives, and laughed at the way she talked when she tried to speak Braavosi. She never let that trouble her. Instead, she showed them all the fig, and told them they were camel cunts, which made them roar with laughter. Gyloro Dothare taught her filthy songs, and his brother Gyleno told her the best places to catch eels. The mummers off the Ship showed her how a hero stands, and taught her speeches from The Song of the Rhoyne, The Conqueror’s Two Wives, and The Merchant’s Lusty Lady. Quill, the sad-eyed little man who made up all the bawdy farces for the Ship, offered to teach her how a woman kisses, but Tagganaro smacked him with a codfish and put an end to that. Cossomo the Conjurer instructed her in sleight of hand. He could swallow mice and pull them from her ears. “It’s magic,” he’d say. “It’s not,” Cat said. “The mouse was up your sleeve the whole time. I could see it moving.” - Cat of the Canals, AFfC

3. Her childishness 

“You don’t even know what a brothel is.”
“I do so,” she insisted. “It’s like an inn, with girls.” - Arya V, ASoS

“ You know the words, but you are too proud to serve. A servant must be humble and obedient.“
"I obey. I can be humbler than anyone.” - The Ugly Little Girl, ADwD

4. Her leave-no-person-behind attitude 

“He’s going to die, and the sooner he does it, the better for the rest of us. We should just leave him, like he says. If it was you or me hurt, you know he’d leave us.“ They scrambled down a steep cut and up the other side, using roots for handholds. "I’m sick of carrying him, and I’m sick of all his talk about yielding too. If he could stand up, I’d knock his teeth in. Lommy’s no use to anyone. That crying girl’s no use either.”
“You leave Weasel alone, she’s just scared and hungry is all.” Arya glanced back, but the girl was not following for once. Hot Pie must have grabbed her, like Gendry had told him.” - Arya V, ACoK

“ She would make much better time on her own, Arya knew, but she could not leave them. They were her pack, her friends, the only living friends that remained to her, and if not for her they would still be safe at Harrenhal, Gendry sweating at his forge and Hot Pie in the kitchens. If the Mummers catch us, I’ll tell them that I’m Ned Stark’s daughter and sister to the King in the North. I’ll command them to take me to my brother, and to do no harm to Hot Pie and Gendry. They might not believe her, though, and even if they did … Lord Bolton was her brother’s bannerman, but he frightened her all the same. I won’t let them take us, she vowed silently, reaching back over her shoulder to touch the hilt of the sword that Gendry had stolen for her. I won’t.” - Arya I, ASoS

5. Her bravery 

“  Robb took them all the way down to the end, past Grandfather and Brandon and Lyanna, to show them their own tombs. Sansa kept looking at the stubby little candle, anxious that it might go out. Old Nan had told her there were spiders down here, and rats as big as dogs. Robb smiled when she said that. “There are worse things than spiders and rats,” he whispered. “This is where the dead walk.” That was when they heard the sound, low and deep and shivery. Baby Bran had clutched at Arya’s hand.
When the spirit stepped out of the open tomb, pale white and moaning for blood, Sansa ran shrieking for the stairs, and Bran wrapped himself around Robb’s leg, sobbing. Arya stood her ground and gave the spirit a punch. It was only Jon, covered with flour. “You stupid,” she told him, “you scared the baby,” but Jon and Robb just laughed and laughed, and pretty soon Bran and Arya were laughing too. ” - Arya IV, AGoT

“ She should be more frightened herself, she knew. She was only ten, a skinny girl on a stolen horse with a dark forest ahead of her and men behind who would gladly cut off her feet. Yet somehow she felt calmer than she ever had in Harrenhal. The rain had washed the guard’s blood off her fingers, she wore a swordacross her back, wolves were prowling through the dark like lean grey shadows, and Arya Stark was unafraid. Fear cuts deeper than swords, she whispered under her breath, the words that Syrio Forel had taught her, and Jaqen’s words too, valar morghulis.” - Arya I, ASoS

As someone who is feminine, i find this kind of annoying because honestly femininity has nothing to do with how i feel about her. So here are my top five reasons for loving Arya Stark:

I could see it moving.” - Cat of the Canals, AFfC

“You don’t even know what a brothel is.”
“I do so,” she insisted. “It’s like an inn, with girls.” - Arya V, ASoS

“ You know the words, but you are too proud to serve. A servant must be humble and obedient.“
"I obey. I can be humbler than anyone.” - The Ugly Little Girl, ADwD

4. Her leave-no-person-behind attitude 

“He’s going to die, and the sooner he does it, the better for the rest of us. We should just leave him, like he says. If it was you or me hurt, you know he’d leave us.“ They scrambled down a steep cut and up the other side, using roots for handholds. I won’t let them take us, she vowed silently, reaching back over her shoulder to touch the hilt of the sword that Gendry had stolen for her. I won’t.” - Arya I, ASoS

5. Her bravery

Robb smiled when she said that. “There are worse things than spiders and rats,” he whispered. “This is where the dead walk.” That was when they heard the sound, low and deep and shivery. and it takes such a toll on her asdfghjkl
hey yo a whole week of arya positivity!!
I wonder if I can hit a whole month oof
summary:
arya stark positivity post
25/01
when a fire breaks out in harrenhal, jaqen h’ghar and two other prisoners are still trapped in...
body:
arya stark positivity post

25/01

when a fire breaks out in harrenhal, jaqen h’ghar and two other prisoners are still trapped in a cage and unable to escape.

arya literally crawls to the sounds of their screams. blinded by smoke, she helps them free themselves before fleeing herself.

when she’s safe in a tunnel away from the flames - still hearing screams and still blinded by smoke and dust - she cries.

blog.name: fedonciadale
blog.title: FedonCiadale
blog.description: Fantasy aficionado since I read Tolkien in my teenage years. I still love Tolkien but I am also into other works. I love ASOIAF (books) and GoT (Show). I also like Brandon Sanderson, Lois McMaster Bujold, in short in my free time it's fantasy...Header by courtesy of ragekitn!

summary: Hi there, I’ve seen people theorizing about Dany’s death. That Jon or Arya or even childbirth will kill her, and to me, those...
question: Hi there, I’ve seen people theorizing about Dany’s death. That Jon or Arya or even childbirth will kill her, and to me, those seem like such unsatisfactory endings for her arc. I’ve always believed Dany’s fate is in her own hands and her own choices. So she either does become a savior/heroic sacrifice death OR she dies for her own hubris and means (eaten by dragon/fall from dragon/killed by fire). Anything else feels like bad writing. What do you think?
answer:
Dear nonny,

I would absolutely hate for Da€nerys to die in childbirth. That would be pretty anticlimatic. I want her to go out in a blaze, like the last dragon she is. A really spectacular death. A hero from the other side, a woman who fulfills the role of the person who had good intentions and went awry. Yes, I want her death to be memorable.

I wouldn’t say it would be not like GRRM to do an anticlimatic death. I always suspected that Walder Frey in the books might just die from old age, because this is what occasionally happens with villains, but I doubt that GRRM has a death like that for a super important antagonist.

As for how she will die, I am a bit torn about that. The Icarus imagery in her arc is very strong and this means that a fall from her dragon would be a possibility. There is also the fact that D herself seems to be convinced that fire “cannot kill a dragon”, and wouldn’t it be nice if that turned out to be wrong - and both would indeed fit into the hubris and fall trope. @rose-of-red-lake has speculated that the famous ‘red door’ might be a dragon’s mouth.

I always wanted her to die a Gollum death - which might come to pass via being eaten by a dragon or via fall from a dragon. I want her to think she has won it all, “her presciousss” only to fall to her death. It would be very nice, if she accidentally helps the case against the WW with her fall.

I’m not so sure about that any longer: I mean I always thought that GRRM wanted to create a beautiful antagonist, someone who would not be seen as a villain immediately, a beautiful Gollum. But D might also be Denethor, the betrayer in the midst of the peopel who fight against evil (and Denethor dies in flames as well!). As much as I would like D to mirror Gollum, I think that there are many more parallels to Denethor and that she will forsake the cause against the WW because she wants to secure her claim. So if she goes for King’s Landing I expect her to fall or die in the flames in the moment she blows the place up.

I must admit that I would hate for Jon to kill her. I don’t want him to become a kinslayer, and other than have Jon killing a woman when he shied from that when he met Ygritte, it doesn’t serve any narrative purpose. Jon and D in a Targbowl has been set up, but Jon as killer not necesssarily. If Jon kills a woman it might be Cersei (although my pet theory is that it will be Bran via warging).

You can make a case for Arya though. We ladies at @delulumeta are checking this theory and we have had some very interesting finds already (I posted one). I’m more and more convinced that this will happen. I do think it would be satisfying for Arya’s arc who wouldn’t kill for revenge but for protection, but it would have to be tied with the hubris arc that is prevalent in D’s story, and I’m not yet sure, how these can be brought together in a satisfying way. I think it can be done, you can have D overreaching, having her moment of triumph and then Arya steps in to protect Jon and finishes her.

GRRM usually manages to have an outcome that is satisfying for several arcs at once and since I think D is important (if an antagonist) I feel that her arc has to be interwoven with the arcs of the others. I think it is possible to do that, have her die of hubris and killed by Arya, but I’m not yet sure how.

For a very long time I’ve believed that D would get a last minute saviour action, either from remorse after burning King’s Landing or accidentally like Gollum - and her being an accidental saviour is something that is also very preeminent in her arc. But I’m not that sure any more. GRRM might really go the whole way and have her die an unrepentent villain.

So, in general I agree with you. Dying in childbirth would be just mehhhh. Very unsatisfactory. But to me the evidence for Arya killing D has set me thinking. It would be difficult to pull that of as satisfactory for D, not unmanagable though - but for Arya it is a very fitting scenario. Her arc which is so much about revenge and mercy and the boundaries that she’ll have to set for herself, that I would really like her to kill not for revenge but for protection as an action that is not directed towards the past but towards the future of her cousin Jon.

Thanks for the ask!

blog.description: Jon/Dany/Bran/Arya Stan. Salty about the got ending. Also likes: The 100,  Star Wars, Stranger Things.

summary:

Sansa: Sorry, what do you look for in a...
body:
Arya: Right, that’s the guy you said the lame stuff about, like he’s a good listener.

Sansa: Sorry, what do you look for in a guy?

Arya: *ogling Gendry* real stuff, like the shape of his ass.

summary: Game Of Thrones: 'Arya Stark' Opens Up About The End Of The Series
title: Game Of Thrones: 'Arya Stark' Opens Up About The End Of The Series
body:
Game Of Thrones: ‘Arya Stark’ Opens Up About The End Of The Series

Everything you need to live well

English actress Maisie Williams who plays Arya Stark in popular HBO SERIES “Game Of Thrones” doesn’t think any of the Game of Thrones cast members will be happy when the show comes to an end.

The 21-year-old actress has somewhat come to terms with the end of the series, but admitted that it’s going to be difficult to move on during an interview with Sky News.

View On WordPress

reblog.comment:

tags: I found this quote somewhere on the internet but I don't remember where
summary: Arya: You deserve a reward for putting up with me. Gendry: You are my reward.
body:
Arya: You deserve a reward for putting up with me.

Gendry: You are my reward.

reblog.comment:
Arya: You deserve a reward for putting up with me.

Gendry: You are my reward.

trail.content_raw:
Arya: You deserve a reward for putting up with me.

Gendry: You are my reward.
trail.content:
Arya: You deserve a reward for putting up with me.

Gendry: You are my reward.

blog.name: lodessa
blog.title: Not a Smut Queen... A Smut Khaleesi
blog.description:
I appear to have tumbled back down into Game of Thrones/A Song of Ice and Fire Fandom again (Jaime/Brienne, Dany/Jorah, Jon/Sansa, amongst other pairings). I'm still living that Star Trek Fan Life (mostly Voyager [Janeway/Chakotay OTP) and Discovery (Admiral Katrina Cornwell and Captain Philippa Georgiou focus). I cannot possibly list everything I might reblog, but forever carrying a torch for Veronica Mars (I live a Weevil appreciation life), Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries, Doctor Who (Nine, Martha Jones), Roslin/Adama, Buffy/Faith, Aral/Cordelia, amongst others.


Testimonial by wakeupgreat:

"lodessa is an amazing human! she can be recognized in the wild by her inara icon and is known across the land for star trek rpf and for being into a song of ice and fire long before it was a tv show. she is a fellow fandom oldie and we relate on many levels. also once she wrote me cersei/brienne so basically she is the BEST."

tags: a song of ice and fire
those two are the most liberated
and asha is more bawdy as opposed to arianne who is a more seductive
margaery is helen haley because she's elegant and nice to ladies in a worse position than her
gilly is evelyn with her nasty deadbeat husband and awful demon son
dany is on racine to represent the continental and political divide
summary: Yet Another AU Idea I Don’t Have Time To Write
title: Yet Another AU Idea I Don’t Have Time To Write
body:
Westeros Characters A League of their Own AU.  

With the war on and all the men away, all our favorite ladies are recruited to “keep baseball going”.   It’s got the perfect mix of ladies being awesome and good at stuff and ladies living in a patriarchal hells-cape that they have absolutely internalized to work with ASOIAF/GOT.

I mean it wouldn’t be an exact matchup.  Sansa and Arya with their sister issues are clearly Dottie and Kit* (Arya absolutely cannot lay off the high ones) but Dottie’s interactions with Jimmy Dugan don’t make sense for Sansa.

 Instead the lion’s share of that dynamic would belong to Brienne (who, of course, also has a lot of Marla’s plot line with being ultra competent but treated in a humiliating subhuman way for not meeting beauty standards) as Jaime would be in the Jimmy role ( I considered Tyrion as the more alcoholic brother, but Jaime has that lost hope/injury made him feel useless/stripped him of his identity plotline… Tyrion can be Ira Lowenstein the “wiz kid” who does his best to save women’s baseball when Tywin as Harvey stops being into the idea). 

*Cat and Lysa would be even more apt as Dottie and Kit but there’s nothing interesting about the rest of the plot/characters if we move it back a generation. (Also no one in the movie is catty enough to be Cersei.)

summary: My feelings towards George are so weird. I look at the pain he has caused me through his books, the evil glint in his eyes in...
body:
My feelings towards George are so weird. I look at the pain he has caused me through his books, the evil glint in his eyes in pictures, and i can swear he is a just a mean old jerk, but then in videos he is a cute old man who giggles at everything and is a complete nerdy dork. 

Why so adorable, George? I am confusion. People, explain!
